column4: What is the dd process in the newest install of Ubuntu? It's eating lots (several %) of my system resources...
Wasnt there in the last version...
I don't know about that stuff but that should be idle most of the time. it uses blocking functions so it shouldn't actuall *do* anything most of the time unless the source is actually being modified.
hm. It takes up resources for me. Constant load of ~0.22 when machine is completley idle
does "tail -f /var/run/klogd/kmsg" roll lots of text or is it not changing?
At a normal file transfer via SSH it takes up as much CPU as the sshd process
Ok. Then that shouldn't be taking any cputime at all.
Obviously it's doing something if it's taking cputime :P
